title: Education Course Type Vocabulary
description: Controlled vocabulary for types of courses or course instances in education programs.

terms.label: Lecture
terms.definition: A course type primarily based on instructor-led presentations and discussions with learners.

terms.label: Laboratory
terms.definition: A course or component focused on hands-on experimentation, labs, or supervised practice activities.

terms.label: Seminar
terms.definition: A course emphasizing discussion, reading, and learner participation, often in smaller groups.

terms.label: Studio
terms.definition: A course with a studio format, common in design, art, architecture, and creative disciplines.

terms.label: Independent Study
terms.definition: A course where a learner works independently under the guidance of an instructor on agreed-upon activities or projects.

terms.label: Internship or Practicum
terms.definition: A course based on supervised work experience, clinical practice, or field placement in a professional setting.

terms.label: Workshop or Short Course
terms.definition: A short, intensive course or workshop focusing on a specific topic or skill set.

terms.label: Other Course Type
terms.definition: A course type that does not fit another, more specific category in this vocabulary but is needed to represent source systems.
